intro: Romulea jugicola, commonly known as the Cape goldcup, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant produces a basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and has a short, stout stem. Its flowers are typically clustered in a single umbel and are often visited by bees and other pollinators. Romulea jugicola is adapted to grow in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in fynbos vegetation.
